content.raw:
A Framerate of about 20Hz is required for visual odometry to work. Typical approaches will just fail if the VO output is only 10Hz or so. 

From my own experiments I see that the MultiCamera sensor and stereo odometry works well - if collected at these frame rates and when looking at visual texture.

The framerate check that John Hsu mentions above is very simplistic and can result in the output being half the nominal rate: if the period between messages is just lower than the nominal period then a publish with regularly be missed.

A moving average might work but the better solution would be to only create the data at the requested framerate and to always publish it.
